result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward L. Hanson Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Sentences of confinement in Taylor Co. Case No. 16CF2 and 16CF9.

miscConds.notes: 6-4-18 - Restitution added to Judgment of Conviction per Order of the Court.

Defendant shall submit a DNA sample.  Defendant shall write a letter of apology to the victim, Rodney Meyer, and be pre-approved by agent.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edward L. Hanson Jr.

Defendant Edward L. Hanson in court with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tlusty places agreement on the record.  Victim rights complied. DE enters a plea of no contest to the charge. Plea colloquy.  Factual basis exists.  Court finds plea given freely, voluntarily and intelligently; accepts plea; find DE guilty.  Court imposed a withheld sentence, placed DE on probation for 1 year, consecutive to Case Nos. 16CF2 and 16CF9, with conditions of: court costs, DNA sample and surcharge; letter of apology to victim, preapproved by agent; restitution, to be determined within 30 days; counseling as deemed appropriate by agent. ba
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 23, 2016 at 11:00 am.
